interface.name: Interpolator

javadoc.text:
*
This interface represents an estimator of the values at a certain point * using surrounding points and values. Interpolators are typically used * with {@link DiscreteFunction discrete functions}. *
As a convenience {@link Interpolator.Linear linear} interpolator class * for point-values of the same {@link Field field} is provided. *
Custom interpolators can be used between Java objects of different kind. * For example:[code] * // Creates a linear interpolator between the java.util.Date and Measures * Interpolator<Date, Amount> linear * = new Interpolator<Date, Amount>() { ... } * DiscreteFunction<Date, Amount> weight * = new DiscreteFunction<Date, Amount>(samples, linear, t); * [/code]
* Estimates the value at the specified point.
javadoc.param: point the point for which the value is estimated.
javadoc.return: the estimated value at the specified point.
